threats.title: Identity theft
threats.mitigation: Hash the password given by the user instead of saving plain text password into the database
threats.description: The login process checks the password given by the user to the one in the database without prior hashing.

threats.mitigation: A role based database access is implemented.
threats.title: Unauthorized access
Data theft
threats.description:
User passwords are saved as plain text which highly increase the likelihood of credential theft. Furthermore SQL injection attack can be conducted against the database.
This threat can lead to disastrous consequences such as the theft of all database records
threats.mitigation:
Password hashes should be saved instead of plain text.
Prepared SQL statements or entity database context should be used.

threats.description: Input received from users can be vector of cross site scripting, SQL injection and many more injection type attacks.
threats.title: Data leakage
threats.mitigation: Filter, escape, validate and encode user input

threats.description: SQL injection that can lead to alter or destroy data from the database
threats.mitigation: SQL prepared statement or framework database context should be used
threats.title: Data alteration
Malicious data insertion
threats.mitigation: Filter , validate and encode user input
threats.description: Harmful user input is potentially stored into the database for malicious intents
Malicious user provided input can be stored
threats.mitigation: Filter, encode and validate user inputs
threats.title: Malicious user input storage

text.text:
Request database to
save recipe data
